et: borrowed from Latin {it}arrogātus,{/it} past participle of {it}arrogāre{/it} "to appoint along with (another magistrate), lay claim to, claim to possess, make undue claims, be conceited," from {it}ar-,{/it} assimilated form of {it}ad-{/it} {et_link|ad-|ad-} + {it}rogāre{/it} "to ask, request" {ma}{mat|rogation|}{/ma}
shortdef: to claim or seize without justification
to make undue claims to having : assume
to claim on behalf of another : ascribe
